artist: Artist: Attributed to Bernardino Poccetti; Artist: after Andrea del Sarto
description: standing woman seen in profile from PR, wearing long skirt and long head covering, also covering her crossed arms; angel to woman's left, slightly bending his knees, with wrists crossed at his chest; angel has curly hair; architectural details in background
inscription:
Inscription, Stamp, Mark

LRC, in pencil: \"Franciabigio; on verso, in brown ink: [No. 4]; on back, in pencil: \"Andrea\"
markings:
Collector\'s stamp, black, at lower left: [CG] Lugt 1171b

Watermark: encircled fleur-de-lys surmounted by tripartite leaf (circle 41 x 40 mm, fleur dy lys, 27 x 31 mm, overall height 62 mm)
medium: Black and white chalk on blue-gray paper
provenance: [Luigi Grassi, Lugt 1171b (1858-1937), Florence]. Sale, Christie's, London, July 6, 1977, no. 3, for Â£165, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Standing Female Saint or Nun and an Angel (after Andrea del Sarto's "Annunciation to Zaccharias")
